website_summaries.verdict: Although not ideal for permanent use, this lightweight aluminum ramp is great for occasional transitions, such as outdoor household steps.
pros: Easy to align and easy to store between uses
Telescoping design for longer stairs or steeper curbs
cons: Stability and sturdiness under load are common concerns
Heavier than expected, may be too challenging for some users to set up

customer_reviews.title: Not what I'd hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Was shipped fast, good packaging, ramps were light enough for me to pick up. Dislike: VERY hard to use (requires a lot of muscle and the ability to push challenging metal buttons while pulling), metal started to bend on second use. Ramps slid all over the place despite grip-like coating. Ramp scratched the heck out of my car when I tried to use it. Bag it came with started to rip after second use. After reading the reviews I'd hoped this would be a good tool for getting my 55lb travel electric wheelchair easily in and out of the family Grand Jeep Cherokee trunk and save us some muscle. It did neither and I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Creatress

customer_reviews.title: Portability and strength
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would have worked for me. It is only 5ft so it would have not worked for a ramp for vehicle as you need 10ft. The raised edges to keep a wheelchair from derailing is too high to use with a Go Chair from Pride. The ramp came in a zippered bag and was light, which is what I wanted, but unable to use because the electric chair has a low clearance and the lip on the ramp prevented it from being able to use.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Good for some things
customer_reviews.text: These ramps seem to be well made, and extending them works well. However, it turns out that having two parallel ramps is a lot less convenient than having one wide ramp. My wheelchair's wheels are enough offset that it isn't easy to line them both up on the two ramps at the same time. I had to mount them to strips of wood to have a perfect distance between the ramps, or I'd miss one with my wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Mills

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to align with wheels. Particularly for wheelchair with different spacing between wheels in front and rear. Hand grip on wheel gets stuck, too.
customer_reviews.author: ScrappyMom

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but bad design in practical use.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good concept but in practice the design isnt working for me. Rolling down is fine, but when you roll something up it’s easy to catch a wheel on one of the overlapping sections and throw the ramps out of alignment and have to start all over.
customer_reviews.author: Pj

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful ramps
customer_reviews.text: The DMI wheel chair ramps are a wonderful product, I use them to load My recumbent trike into the van. I tell all My triker buddy's about the ramps , the light weight and ease of use. I looked at numerous styles of ramps that were either too bulky or expensive and then I saw these, perfect for my needs. I am very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.author: Rick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Should be screwed down to keep them from moving when using. Wants to move around on ya.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A necessary accommodation for wheelchair guests at an affordable price and convenient storage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have on hand for a guest arriving in a wheelchair. Stable and good traction. Needs careful alignment before entering and don't skimp on length. The heavy duty carrying case was an unanticipated bonus. I store it where the person who used it can arrange to access it and take it to anywhere he needs it.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Viking

customer_reviews.title: Not too sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a ramp that I could use for multiple locations (i.e front, back and garage) so I liked the idea that this was extendable. The ramp was not sturdy and it was a little cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jamel1999

customer_reviews.title: Wheelchair Ramp
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to provide access to my house for my brother. It was a great idea that won't work for me. I am gifting the ramps to charity, someone in a regular wheelchair will appreciate the mobility and access these ramps provide. Ramp is well designed and comes with a nifty travel bag. You must consider two limitations: the ramp is designed for going up three steps MAX. Also if your wheels on the front and back are offset (do not lineup) the ramp will not work. The channels are too narrow for offset wheels. If your wheel chair is battery powered, this ramp may not work.
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: Is not universal to fit all wheelchairs
customer_reviews.text: Not wide enough for both front and back wheels to fit in at the same time?
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L White

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Great item for what we needed. Temporary ramp for a wheel chair up 2 steep stairs. The ramps worked great with room for the ambulatory members in the family to continue normal use of the stairs. My mom is around 116lbs, and I know they said weight up to 600lbs, but I would be scared to use it on anyone over 400 lbs plus wheelchair. Just my thought, they are rated to take up to 600lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Dee A

customer_reviews.title: Ramps
customer_reviews.text: One of the ramps would not extend and when I went to return the set of ramps I had to pay for the return postage. The Seller should have covered the postage because the item was defective.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The best way to describe this is just one word JUNK
customer_reviews.author: charlotte hale

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my sister and she has used them a few times and it made it really easy to get out of her house.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: watch out. both wheels of a wheelchair (on each ...
customer_reviews.text: watch out. both wheels of a wheelchair (on each side) don't easily fit into the 'channel'. otherwise, good and sturdy, easy to position, very nice carrier when you put it away.
customer_reviews.author: geezerguy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, just what I needed. It's adjustable, easy to adjust, and mobile. I bought it for my elderly mom, who is wheelchair bound.
customer_reviews.author: Maitai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We had this product shipped to Mexico and the family is very happy with this product. The ramp also arrived a week earlier than expected. Really easy to have something like this shipped out of the U.S.A.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wheel care ramp
customer_reviews.text: bought them for my husband he really loved them. just himself had a little troble using them but with help they where very useful at the time he needed them since his passing. i passed them to another person that loves them her self
customer_reviews.author: barb

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting up curbs or a steep step but ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable. I am bariatric and felt confident they would hold me. Great for getting up curbs or a steep step but not much more.
customer_reviews.author: Meesha77

customer_reviews.title: Needs work
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I'd hoped. Be sure you can lift and you'll need to be good at placing them in a way that will work. For me that was hard. Maybe they'll work better for you. Do you wanna buy 'em?
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, sturdy and easy to set up. Much easier to roll wheelchair into van or truck and stairs then lifting 35lb wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: dojoqueen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Definitely helps get in and out of the house
customer_reviews.author: Jill C.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for concrete stairs outside my mother's condo. One steep step then a landing. Then 2 steps. Works like a charm to get her moving quickly and effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Fits the Wheelchair great!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, I carry them in my car. Use them all the time for my husbands wheelchair,
customer_reviews.author: melba m

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I need to return this item. The rails are not wide enough to fit the wheels on the wheel chair. They also kept moving while I was trying to use them they are very inconvenient in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: leslie

customer_reviews.title: What we needed when we needed it
customer_reviews.text: Needed for house with lot of 2 step ups and downs. Easy to install and works well.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hamann

customer_reviews.title: this is WONDERFUL! So handy to use and to store
customer_reviews.text: WISH I HAD FOUND THIS A YEAR AGO!!!!! For someone who just started using a wheel chair and has steps in their home, this is WONDERFUL! So handy to use and to store! We take them on visits and trips!
customer_reviews.author: tommyeCornish

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for portability
customer_reviews.text: These rails are easy to use and adjust. They have made a big difference in being able to access outside areas of our home without a big and bulky ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog97

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I could not use it cause my wheelchair wouldn't fit through the door
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: ... little time to line them up but they work great!!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little time to line them up but they work great!!! I am very happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for my dad's wheelchairs to get in the house..
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: For equipment with wheels: Light, easy to use & transportable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for use in getting equipment up into a minivan. Our boxed equipment has wheels and weighs 200 lbs so we couldn't lift the box easily. These ramps did the trick without hurting my scrawny back. Ramps come with a carrying bag. The whole thing is surprisingly light and easily transportable. I was able to put it in a checked luggage for a flight. (Just check your airline for weight and dimension limitations. Jetblue was fine.) I read lots of reviews and threw the dart at this product and hit the bullseye. We are buying another one for my colleague to use too.
customer_reviews.author: MS.NK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use wheel chair ramp!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in narrow locations and very easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ldr

customer_reviews.title: very pleased. but...
customer_reviews.text: i understand how many people are disappointed if they have a wheelchair that has wheels in the rear that are further apart than the wheels in the front (or vise verse). These ramps WOULD NOT WORK for them, however, if your wheels are inline and you set the ramps perfectly straight and at the correct distance from each other, they work fine. very sturdy. well made. light weight. good design.
customer_reviews.author: mister persnickety

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, exactly what I need light weight, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Krystyna  Karpinska

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, a good product just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: So far so good,a good product just what I needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They move sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok and does what Its supposed to , just not very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Made and Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: These are well constructed and function as described. Just be sure the wheel chair front wheels are in-line with the rear wheels (same spacing). The tracks don't have a lot of room for error. However, being narrow means these ramps are lightweight and portable and that's why be ordered them. Much easier than having four people lift the chair into the house. Nice carrying bag also.
customer_reviews.author: Paul DJ

customer_reviews.title: Sincerely BILLY Dean Kuykendall Jr
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect except it could extend i foot longer
customer_reviews.author: Billy Dean Kuykendall jr

customer_reviews.title: ... portable ramp was what I needed and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The portable ramp was what I needed and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: totally worth the money !!! love that it comes with a travel case to close them up when u go somewhere
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: because these were not good.
customer_reviews.text: The ramps do not stay in place, they do not feel safe or secure, after ordering these, I had a permanent ramp built on my house, because these were not good.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Fuson

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: My wife couldn't use this with her wheelchair at all. It felt very wobbly and it was very hard to line up with her wheels. Returned it and got a staircase ramp instead.
customer_reviews.author: AlanAndMel

customer_reviews.title: We ordered this for our daughter who is in a ...
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for our daughter who is in a wheelchair. It didn't have enough space for the front and rear tires of the wheelchair to fit on the ramp so we returned it for a refund. Amazon charged us $32 for shipping it back and I'm a prime member. I will be changing my membership.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Martin

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: We needed a light portable set of ramps for my power chair when we visit friends or family with one or two steps to enter their homes. We have a light weight Hoveround MVP power chair with caster type rear wheels. When we try to drive our chair up the ramp, the rear wheels try to pivot and get stuck sideways between the sides of the ramps. The only way we can use the ramps, is to release the automatic brakes in the chair and push it up or down the ramps. That will only work if you have someone around with a strong back. On the positive side, the ramps are light and easy to carry, store and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: roll it up
customer_reviews.text: the ramps are heavy duty, they handle the wheel chair fine. Easy to take out of case and put down on the steps, just as easy to put back into case. If you don't want the expense of built ramps, these will do the job. They are also portable so you can take them with so you can get the person in the chair up most short stairs.... would wreck amend this product Michael
customer_reviews.author: Michael S., Preston

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Okay product for someone that is not over 250 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are very handy to have. They are very compact and come with a nylon carrying case so they don't slide around and store easily in the trunk or your car or on a shelf. I could never go over to friends houses because of steps but now with these cool little ramps I can go. I wish I had bought these a long time ago. For the price you can't go wrong. I still don't know what the question mark is behind the 5 or the "one" and the end of the description. They come as a pair.
customer_reviews.author: G Cook

customer_reviews.title: Ramps are perfect for getting the power wheelchair in&out of the back ...
customer_reviews.text: Ramps are perfect for getting the power wheelchair in&out of the back of the van. Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita Dow

customer_reviews.title: satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Our mother can no longer do steps and we needed some sort of ramp system to cover the two steps into the house. This is adequate although I wish I had gone with the solid ramp instead, it would save the set-up time and getting the ramps at just the right distance apart. For the price thought, it does help us get Mom in and out of the house when we need to.
customer_reviews.author: judy singley

customer_reviews.title: I've used the ramps four times and purchased a 2nd ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the ramps four times and purchased a 2nd set. Lining them up is the most difficult part of using the ramps. They work well with enough space to keep slope of the incline manageable.
customer_reviews.author: DaveT

customer_reviews.title: They may work for wheelchairs with bicycle tires.
customer_reviews.text: My wheelchair has the wheel plus the assist. I slid out of my house because the assist sits on top of the ramp edges! I couldn't get back into my house. I have a folding 5' ramp but was hoping these would work since they would take up less space in the SUV. We are moving so trying these again will have to wait.
customer_reviews.author: magic

customer_reviews.title: too narrow
customer_reviews.text: It was so narrow that the 3 wheels on each side of the power wheel chair wouldn't fit, it also had no way of keeping it from sliding off the rear of the van
customer_reviews.author: bdiscount

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It can't fit my wheelchair since it is too narrow and too shallow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sides are quite high making them useless for anything with less than 5 inches of clearance
customer_reviews.text: These have very limited use. Most powered scooters ride too low for these ramps. The sides are quite high making them useless for anything with less than 5 inches of clearance
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: It does work
customer_reviews.text: It light and works as expected. The ramps are light and easy to set up. They require some initial adjustment ( as the space between rails barely fit the front and rear wheels when the wheelchair is in the ramp) I needed to put some marks in the base of the stairs, to place the ramps in the precise place. Once this is done, they work as a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Javicho

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: these are well made and easy to set into place. My husband can now enjoy our deck.
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Product dies what it says but that did not meet ...
customer_reviews.text: Product dies what it says but that did not meet my needs. Had to physically check it out to be sure. I need similar product that is about 9-10 feet long, weighs the same or only slightly more, maintain same tensile strength and increase price proportionally.
customer_reviews.author: william fisher

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Fit Power Wheelchairs
customer_reviews.text: These ramps DO NOT fit power wheelchairs. The opening is too narrow for the wide wheel & it can only be used for thin wheels that are not offset. I should have paid more attention to the previous reviews before I purchased it. If the company would have done their research, the opening could have been made wider to compensate for the power wheelchair wheels & it would have been a perfect telescoping ramp. I requested a return and, AS USUAL, Amazon gave me super customer service. They had the package picked up in 1 day & issued me a refund at the time of pickup.
customer_reviews.author: WarrenJS

customer_reviews.title: Shame on me. Shame on them
customer_reviews.text: I read the bad reviews and thought to myself " I can probable make it work." Well, that was 99 bucks down the gutter. Now it'll be another $200 to get a decent pair of ramps. People nowadays use motorized chairs and those wheels don't match the narrow ramps. Do not make my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: khai

customer_reviews.title: Ramps
customer_reviews.text: This product is lightweight and very portable. Has made life much easier for my mother and my family to transport her.
customer_reviews.author: ANN L. THOMPSON

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for our situation
customer_reviews.text: We have limited space to access the beginning of the ramps, we have to approach at an angle. Because of that, we found that the individual ramps would shift out of alignment of the wheelchair wheels. Additionally, our caregiver was concerned and unsure how she could push the chair up the equivelant of just one step since she couldn't walk up the ramp. Overall it was just too unstable and seemingly dangerous for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: TERESA JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Ramps don't work.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ramps for my wheelchair. Unfortunately they do not work at all. The ramps are to narrow for the wheelchair wheels to aligned properly. I do not recommend this product for purchase for anyone with a wheelchair.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The tracks were too narrow for the wheels of the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne J. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a for a full size wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: The ramps are not wide enough and stable enough for a person on a wheelchair if the incline is greater than 20 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Baback Nemazie

customer_reviews.title: Wheelchair ramps
customer_reviews.text: They are too narrow, too unstable and generally more trouble than lifting the wheel chair
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K. Cimmet

customer_reviews.title: Wheelchair Ramps
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Light, strong. Easy to use. Makes getting a wheelchair over sills, doorstops, etc. simple. The telescoping feature is great
customer_reviews.author: David Zabinski

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't stay up it fall down with the wc in it
customer_reviews.author: David Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to carry in the car.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for portable ramps for my daughter's wheelchair when we go from place to place and these do get the job done. When they are telescoped down to the shortest length, they are vary easy to handle and relatively light weight. My only complaint is that I wish they were an inch or so wider. Every once in a while, the front caster wheel on her wheelchair gets caught up, but with some practice and better alignment, it is manageable. The bag is convenient and these are a great addition to our car for day trips or vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Fontaine Jr

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: While the overall idea is good, getting them lined up so that both front and back wheels of a manual wheelchair is nearly impossible. The sections aren't really wide enough to span from the inside of the front wheels to the outside of the back wheels making them difficult to use and more of a hassle than a help. I only rate them as 2 stars because the overall idea was good and they are well constructed. Just not wide enough to really do what they are intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Schirripa

customer_reviews.title: Helping Hand for unable people
customer_reviews.text: My twin and I are caring for our elderly mom with very bad dementia can't stand or walk. With this portable wheelchair helped us use it on steers even taking her out around the block too...Thxxxx so much for very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: best solution
customer_reviews.text: eliminates pulling me up a step or three or lifting me up ... VERY durable .....very easy to use ............. carrying bag keeps them from moving around in the back of our van ..... well worth the cost
customer_reviews.author: Chajin

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy ramps
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are off the hook. They are very sturdy and very well built. They are so good and expandable and at a very good price, that I bought another set.
customer_reviews.author: WirenutBull

customer_reviews.title: Make sure this style suits your purpose
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. However, I wanted it to enable me to get a friend in a wheelchair into my house. It would have been better to have gotten a 1 piece ramp, since it is hard to keep the 2 ramps aligned under the wheels in use.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: These are very convenient to have on hand "just in case". Lightweight, and size makes them easier to use and carry. I was worried about height clearance, but it is fine. I actually do not use them as a permannent ramp at home, but to have them in the car when needed is great.
customer_reviews.author: wannabe

customer_reviews.title: Very bad
customer_reviews.text: very bad, can not stand the weight because I bought I have a scooter, but it is also very strange, so they did not put Free retorn.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Schulmann

customer_reviews.title: Super light and sturdy convenience
customer_reviews.text: Bought this ramp to get a relatives wheelchair into our house for the holidays and it worked out super slick. We only have a couple steps to get the wheelchair up and into the house and for the cost and convenience this product cannot be beat. If you have more than a few steps, you may need a different product.
customer_reviews.author: CamperMN

customer_reviews.title: The rims were too narrow for the four wheels on ...
customer_reviews.text: The rims were too narrow for the four wheels on my wheelchair. I donated it to a shelter. And bought the Aluminum multifold wheelchair scooter mobility 6 foot portable ramp.
customer_reviews.author: judith barrington

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: I am using these ramps to roll my recumbent trike into a Rav4. It's perfect, they collapes down easy and are easy to extend.
customer_reviews.author: Carol K

customer_reviews.title: Happy with performance
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the performance of this product. Strong, lightweight, easy to setup. Storage pouch is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: John Mayo-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Useless product..
customer_reviews.text: Not good at all, I wish I could return that ramp. It twists and goes out of place and almost killed my old mother-in-law. But she did not die, she is still alive, and she is wise enough not to let us use that ramp.
customer_reviews.author: DR. Luigi A. Pavone

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight & easy to use. These ramps have enabled my Mom to attend the holidays and sleepovers at my house. These ramps have helped my Mom not miss out on important events with her family. I am so glad we made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Too flimsy. Was very disappointed in the product. When I tried to roll my Mothers wheelchair up both ramps they wanted to scoot and flip. When I tried to bring her down ramps would not stay in place constantly moving about. Scared her she made me promise that I would not use them again. She was scared that she would fall to the pavement and be injured. Not sturdy at all. I bought another product that worked 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a lifesaver to get our mother in her wheelchair into our house. The product is not too heavy, easy to store in the provided bag and easy to install in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: For my mom this was not the best. The front wheels are not in line with ...
customer_reviews.text: For my mom this was not the best. The front wheels are not in line with back so very difficult to use because of that.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: No longer Limited on where or when we can go.
customer_reviews.text: I am so VERY happy with this purchase. This allows me to easily load my Cerebral Palsy son's Manual wheelchair into our new van.
customer_reviews.author: Mally's Mom

customer_reviews.title: The ramp is easy to use and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The ramp is easy to use and sturdy. It's good for traversing maybe three steps up - usually enough (and would have to be much bigger to do more). We found it trickier to wheel someone down than up - gravity is funny that way.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence B. Cahoon

customer_reviews.title: I liked the fact that it was very portable and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Due to a change in circumstances, the ramp was no longer needed; however, it seemed to be very user friendly and ideal. I liked the fact that it was very portable and adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Hilda Z.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my needs and very easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and compact storage makes this the best selection.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and compact storage makes this the best selection.
customer_reviews.author: CSM96

customer_reviews.title: Scared me half to death
customer_reviews.text: Hubby's wheelchair barely madw the trip up this ramp with help. Actual ramps where thinner than casters and wheels.
customer_reviews.author: trm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust ramp that enables mobility chair owners to load their chair and have no need to buy a carrier..
customer_reviews.text: Great ramp and easy to adjust at a very reasonable cost..
customer_reviews.author: Jim Moss

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy ramps. Love the ability to fold everything down into a carry case for compact storage.
customer_reviews.author: Wilmraven

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and easy to use! Made transport a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Shannel

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but something to consider...
customer_reviews.text: We have used this in several scenarios and it has performed great. One thing to consider because of the design of the device is you may need to move the foot rests on the wheelchair when using it. If you can't adjust the foot rests on your wheelchair, this may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: plan9fan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Ramps for Me
customer_reviews.text: We have a sunken family room that is two steps down, a twelve inch heighth. I needed wheelchair ramps to move my wife's chair into and out of this room occasionally. I have used them for a couple of months now and really like them. Being two entirely separate ramps they can be spaced exactly to your width needs. They are very easy to collapse and to stretch to their full length. They are perfect for the need I had.
customer_reviews.author: Dewitt Glasgow

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good function. Requires non-slip pad for .30 degree incline but what a back saver!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Higgins Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps
customer_reviews.text: These are handy little ramps, sturdy but lightweight. They are easy to set up and take down. I'd buy them again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: These have been so nice! They are super light weight and very easy ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been so nice! They are super light weight and very easy to move and use. They came with a case to keep them from sliding around in the van. If you're using them frequently I would use a permanent marker to mark where to place the ramps so you don't have to guess or eyeball it every time. It is a little tricky to get them lined up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie Jenkins

product_meta.title: MABIS DMI Healthcare Portable Wheelchair Ramp/Threashold Ramp, Adjustable, Telescoping, Retractable, and Lightweight Loading Ramp with Cover, Silver
product_meta.description:
DMI Telescoping Retractable Lightweight Portable Wheelchair Ramps, Adjustable from 3 to 5 feet

These retractable, adjustable wheelchair ramps are a handy item to have in your home so wheelchair users can easily come and go from rooms that have steps. They are also great to have around for visitors if your entrance has a step or curb. Wheelchair users will also find them invaluable when visiting friends or family who may not have accessible entrances. Light and compact, these portable ramps are easy to travel with or store in the truck of your car. Each ramp weighs only 6 pounds, making them easy to lift and position. They extend from 3 to 5 feet, so you can use them on different step sizes and heights (see measuring directions). Each ramp can support 330 pounds (660 pounds total between them). 

How to Use 

Two ramps are included. To extend the ramps, pull sections one and two until the locking buttons are fully extended into the holes and snap into place. After use, simply retract them and put them away in their convenient nylon carrying bag. They are easy to take with you when traveling.

How to Measure for Wheelchair Ramps

To calculate the length of the ramp you will need, first you need to measure the rise. The rise is the measurement between the ground and where the top of the ramp will be placed. The American with Disabilities Act (ADA) requires that public areas have wheelchair ramps with an incline of 4.8 degrees or less (a ratio of 1:12). This equals one foot of ramp for every inch of rise. For residential areas such as homes, ADA recommends a 2:12 slope. This equals one foot of ramp for every two inches of rise. To calculate the ramp length you will need, divide the rise by two. For home use, these ramps would work for rises up to 10 inches.

Next, you need to measure the width of your wheelchairandrsquo;s wheels. These ramps have an inner track area of 4 inches. Be certain each wheel is no wider than 4 inches before ordering.

Features

 * Two telescoping, adjustable wheelchair ramps easily extend for use with steps, curbs or vehicles then retract for storage
 * Strong rust resistant aluminum construction with durable non-skid u-shaped tracks for added safety
 * Easily adjustable from 3 to 5 feet with push-button lock mechanism; see measuring instructions before ordering
 * Each ramp can support up to 330 pounds for a total of 660 pounds between them
 * Ramps are lightweight (6 pounds each) and portable in a convenient nylon storage bag; great for travel
 * Inside track area: 4 inches wide
 * Retracted size: 6.5 x 29 inches
 * Easy to assemble with no tools
feature_bullets: Non Skid Portable Wheelchair Ramp Is Perfect for Steps, Curbs, Vehicles and More With Non Skid U Shaped Tracks for Added Safety and Stability. Dimensions of One Ramp: 7 Inch x 3 Feet 5 Feet With a 4.5 Inch Inside Width
Easily Adjustable, Telescoping, and Retractable for Easy and Convenient Storage at Home, in Vehicles, and More. Adjusts From 3 to 5 Feet With Simple Push Button Lock Mechanism
RUST RESISTANT, DURABLE, AND LIGHTWEIGHT ALUMINUM construction as each wheelchair ramp can support up to 300 pounds, totaling 600 pounds between them, but only weighs 6 pounds each
To be used by occupied wheelchairs with the assistance of another person
Not recommended for powered scooter or chairs, or those with offset wheels or less than 2.5in ground clearance of the push ring
NO TOOL EASY ASSEMBLY AND INCLUDES NYLON STORAGE BAG making it great for travel, transporting, and storing. Inner track sized at 4 inches wide with track rails 2.25 inches high
